page.title: 11A Child's Day
page.content: My name is Paul and I live in Guist. I wake up at six o'clock, get dressed, wash, and then get on with my homework. When Mum comes down she asks what I want for breakfast and I say, 'Weetabix'. When it is eight o'clock I go down the the lay-by to play with my friends and wait for the school bus. First the Fakenham bus comes, and then ours, and we pick up the Wood Norton and Stibbard children on the way. When the school whistle goes at 9.00 a.m we line up and go into the classroom and get on straight away with some Mathematics. We have a break at 10.40 and morning school ends at 12.00 noon. We eat our sandwiches in the hall and play outside until the afternoon session which lasts from 1.30 p.m. until 3.25 p.m. when the school bus takes us home again.
